Health Coaching: An Emerging Trend In Personal Health and Wellness

Megan Mountcastle, MSW, Certified Health Counselor, provides individual, customized health counseling programs for people who would like to incorporate healthy eating into their lifestyle and reach their health goals. Megan specializes in working with people who are struggling with daily stomach pain that gets in the way of their daily lives. By helping her clients figure out what foods and lifestyle factors are triggering their pain, Megan helps them reduce and prevent stomach attacks so that they can heal their digestive systems and get back to their lives. In this presentation, Megan will present her approach to working with clients, which is part of an emerging movement toward health “coaching.” The health coaching approach bridges the gap between the consumer’s desire for a healthier lifestyle and their ability to achieve their goals. By working with clients in a six month customized health program, Megan is able to track her client’s progress, coach them toward real, lasting change, and help them get inspired about living a healthy lifestyle.

Bio
Megan A. Mountcastle, MSW, CHC is the founder of Santé Health Counseling. She is a Certified Health Counselor, accredited by the American Association of Drugless Practitioners. Additionally, Megan earned a master's degree in Social Work from Simmons College. Appreciating and studying both Western and Eastern approaches to health and wellness, Megan advocates for a preventative model of wellness. Providing individual and group programs for people who would like to learn about healthy eating and living, Megan has specialized in making healthy eating accessible and fun, as well as supporting women who are struggling with chronic digestive issues to heal through nutrition and lifestyle changes. Megan works from a holistic approach, which recognizes the importance of not only our physical health, but also our relationships, career and life circumstances.
